answers.answer: HI!Everybody has yeast on their skin and in their GI tract. This is totally normal and is not an infection.  Usually there are also other bacteria present that compete with the yeast and keep it at bay.  If you are healthy and have no symptoms, it is highly unlikely that you have systemic yeast--which is usually only seen in immunocompromised individuals.  It never hurts to take probiotics or acidophillus--as these have lactobacillus, which are healthy bacteria that compete with yeast.  If you were my patient, that is probably all I would recommend doing at this time!Good luck!Dr B

question: I read about systemic yeast infections and I'm overal healthy except for herpes...no cancer or diabetes or anything majorly wrong with me.  I've had hives and really dry hair and skin problems and some joint pain and fatigue and my periods are really bad with cramps and PMS.  Every test I've had (thryoid, RA factor) are negative/normal. Yearly physical bloodwork normal... Could it be a fungal infection?  How common are they in  healthy women?I don't have any of the usual symptoms in the vaginal area.  No burning or itchy or cottage cheese discharge...I have been told by my gyno before that I am a little more yeasty than most women probably.  I get a lot of discharge..no smell or anything.I've also noticed that my boyfriend's genital area smells yeasty sometimes.  It's not a foul smell or anything...just smells like bread lol  could we be harvesting a yeast infection?Please help!
title: Can you have a yeast infection without the main symptoms?
